Context:
The cyber security professional program at this college covers topics such as cyber security and hacking, attack surfaces, methods for compromising them, and vulnerability mitigation in the third semester. Students will learn advanced ethical hacking incident response techniques and will have the opportunity to showcase their skills through a capstone group project. required skills include digital forensics and incident response management, ethical hacking and malware analysis, delivering security training, and applying cryptography. Non-technical skills needed are analytical skills, written and verbal communication, project and time management skills, and interpersonal and conflict management skills.

Graduates of this program will be prepared to help defend organizations from various cyber threats such as malware, network attacks, and data compromise. They will know how to monitor, assess, and evaluate security risks and threats to physical and digital infrastructure and develop and implement security contingency planning and policies to mitigate risks.

The program is delivered in a blended format combining face-to-face sessions with online delivery, and attendance is required in the late afternoons and evenings during the week and all day Saturday. Students must have access to a personal laptop with 8 GB RAM (16 GB recommended), support for virtualization, a 256 GB SSD Hard Drive (500+ GB optimal), a 2 TB minimum external hard drive, a webcam + mic, and consistent access to a reliable high-speed internet connection.

Career opportunities include increasing demand for cyber security professionals due to the rise in cyber attacks, with an estimated gap of over three million worldwide. Students who successfully complete this program may qualify for entry into Ontario college graduate certificate and university degree programs.

Context:
Program: Information Technology or Computer Sciences or related field, or any field with one year of related work experience
Tuition & Fees:
- Domestic Tuition (estimated for first three semesters starting Fall 2023): $12,602.00
- International Tuition (estimated for first three semesters starting Fall 2023): $27,055.00
- Domestic Tuition (estimated for first three semesters starting Fall 2024): Not specified
- International Tuition (estimated for first three semesters starting Fall 2024): Not specified
Additional Costs: Not specified
Financial Assistance: Approved for OSAP funding for applicants who meet eligibility criteria
Admission Requirements: Two-year college diploma or bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Sciences or a related field OR two- or three-year college diploma or bachelor's degree in any field PLUS one year of related work experience. Resumé should be submitted through ontariocolleges.ca for domestic applicants or via the GBC Online Application System (OAS) for international applicants
English Language Proficiency: Essential. International applicants without English proficiency test results must take the George Brown College English assessment to be considered for admission
Course Exemptions: College or university credits may qualify for course exemptions. Visit Transfer Guide for more information
Application Process: Domestic students apply through Ontario Colleges and international students visit How to Apply page for application process details
Country-specific Admission Requirements: International applicants should refer to the International Admissions page for country-specific admission requirements.

Please note that fees are subject to change without notice, and this information is subject to change without notice as well. Students are responsible for verifying George Brown College fee requirements and English language proficiency requirements.

Context:
International students should apply through the George Brown College Online Application System. For more information on how and when to apply, visit the "How to Apply" page. The School of Computer Technology can be contacted at 416-415-5000, ext. 4287 or email: computertechnology@georgebrown.ca. The office hours are Monday – Friday: 9 a.m. – 4 p.m. The Cyber Security program is offered through the School of Computer Technology from the Casa Loma Campus at 146 Kendal Avenue in Toronto. Contact can be made for an information session or campus tour. International students are encouraged to contact international recruitment representatives by booking a virtual meeting or submitting an inquiry on the "International Contact Us" page. The Cyber Security (Postgraduate) program code is T433, and related programs include Information Systems Business Analysis (T405) and Wireless Networking (T411). For more information, book a campus tour or get answers to questions by booking an info session. To receive tailored resources for application, sign up on the website.
